Reviews.Content: Excellent choice _Cinzia_Panayiotis_ Greece You can鈥檛 get any closer to the Duomo. For those that have seen 鈥淩oom with a view鈥? no. 11 is what they are looking for. Of course you need to stretch a bit, but who minds.It is a small hotel, clean and comfortable with a variation in furniture depending upon the room. One of its great assets, if you travel by car, is that it has private parking. This is extremely rare in the centre of the city, especially if you take into account the reasonable prices. Both Marco and Giorgio are extremely helpful, but their elegance of mind and spirit is what makes the difference.
Reviews.Author: AnimaMundiAthens

Reviews.Content: Okay but look elsewhere Hotel Dali is in a great location close to the all major sites and few mins walk to Galleria Accademia and duomo. The room overlooking the courtyard is by far the best room that includes a kettle and small fridge - no other place in europe we stayed had this. Rooms are clean and one bathroom large, the other very small with no hooks to hang clothes or towels etc. The staff are very helpful and extremely thoughtful and you cannot fault this. Marco the owner speaks excellent English and Grazia not a word of English but is soooo nice and very helpful. The accommodation is very basic, rooms are average and the ones on the street are quite noisy, poky and I wouldn't want to stay more than a couple of nites. We were asked to move rooms so I can comment on both rooms. We prebooked the accommo but would suggest that there are other hotels same price or cheaper close by that offer more facilities and are good, so look around. You would have no trouble in October finding accommodation on arrival. The stay was okay but I would not stay here again. NOTE: On check-out we were told cash only, so had to rush off to find an ATM, we could have been told this at check-in.
Reviews.Author: Roseanne2

Reviews.Content: Perfect place for staying in Florence A small and a very friendly hotel made staying in Florence even better than it already was.Dali is a small familiy hotel, located in a quiet place but only within 3 minutes walk from the magnificent Duomo.It's really clean and comfortable, and the staff is very very friendly.Marco speaks great English, and is really helpful. All of the staff is really nice and welcoming.The price is really fair for center of Florence.
Reviews.Author: kodon

Reviews.Content: A best little place to stay in Florence My senior friends and I found this clean, secure and friendly little hotel just what we were looking for. Marco. who speaks perfect English was wonderful to help us find our way around Florence. It was quiet and reasonable and we will stay there again on our next visit to Florence.
Reviews.Author: jnsatl

Reviews.Content: Excellent Value in Florence We spent five nights in the Hotel Dali based on the recommendation in the Rick Steves guidebook. The hotel met all our expectations. We were in the middle of a driving trip in Europe and the hotel offers free parking in a secure lot. We had a room facing the courtyard so it was quiet. If you get a street side room it could be noisy since there is a hospital with an emergency room about a block away. The room was clean, with basic amenities and a large bathroom. Marco, the owner, was extremely helpful. He speaks excellent English. He helped us register the car to avoid the congestion tax, and book tickets for the Uffizi. His recommendations for restaurants were excellent. The hotel does not serve breakfast, but there were several nearby cafes where you could get a brioche and expresso for 2 Euros. There are not a lot of frills, but you get excellent value for the money. The central location means that you are within easy walking distance to all major attractions.
Reviews.Author: WisRiver

Reviews.Content: Florentine value The Hotel Dali is only a short walking distance from everything. Our room faced the courtyard, so was quiet. Proprietor Marco, was always helpful, patient and professional and a font of Florentine knowledge. The room we stayed in had a kettle and small fridge. Shared bathrooms and toilets clean. Room was clean and simply furnished. Value (for Florence) fantastic.
Reviews.Author: cuthman1

Reviews.Content: Great Place This hotel had a great location. Everything was within walking distance. The desk clerk Marco was great. He was more than willing to help us find little stores and great places for dinner. The hotel doesn't have a lot of frills but you aren't going to Florence to stay in a hotel room. We got a double bed which was really 2 twins pushed together which was great. We had our own full bathroom which was small but functional. Would definately recommend for a nice clean place to sleep.
Reviews.Author: MsLea

Reviews.Content: Great Location, Friendly Staff I attribute our wonderful stay in Florence to Marco at Hotel Dali. When we checked in he gave us a city map and circled everything we would want to see while in Florence and recommended restaurants. He booked our tickets in advance (upon request) for Accadamia and Uffizi Museums. We had a condensed visit to Florence and staying at Hotel Dali enabled us to do alot in a short time. The rooms were clean and roomy for 4 adults. We stayed on courtyard side which was quiet. At first glance the stairway was a bit scary but felt welcoming by the second ascent when we were foot-weary. Staying at Hotel Dali was like staying with relatives, very homelike and friendly.
Reviews.Author: Barbtravels

Reviews.Content: Basic hotel for a fair price! We stayed at the hotel Dali for 1 night. We had a room with an ensuite bathroom. Our room was pretty basic. The bed was comfortable. The room was clean. The bathroom was small but manageable. The shower however didn't drain properly. Water drained really slowly, so our shower was quick to prevent any flooding. There is no cable or satelliate for the TV and there was no internet connect. But what we paid for the room, i'd say it's a pretty good deal for European standards.
Reviews.Author: BeetleBumbee

Reviews.Content: A Treasure in Tuscany The Hotel Dali is a wonderful way to experience Florence. It is centrally located, a short walking distance away from the major sites and morning coffee places, yet it feels quiet and intimate. Our room faced the courtyard, so we can't comment on whether the rooms facing the street are noisy.The bathroom was small but manageable and had a great shower. There is a lift to get up the flights of stairs to enter. Our room was across from the office, but we weren't disturbed by noise. The room was spacious by European standards, and had a wonderful view of a courtyard. Our routine was to buy coffe and breakfast from a nearby shop and eat in our room while looking out at the view. A great way to start the day! We give high marks to proprietor Marco, who was always helpful, patient and friendly regarding tourist attractions, places to eat, and even finding schedules for trains out of town. I can't stop drinking the Limoncello, one of the things Marco recommended as an after-dinner drink. We didn't want to leave, had to tear ourselves away.!Ole for the Hotel Dali! P.S. For a great meal, check out Il Barroccio on Via Della Vigna Vecchia or Osteria Di (Platti?) on Via Verdi. If you pass Sante Croce Square you have gone too far.
Reviews.Author: VandPF

Reviews.Content: Loved the Staff I found Hotel Dali in the Lonely Planet guide and corresponded with Marco via email. All i can say is lucky i found this wonderful homey and comfortable hotel in the heart of Firenze! I stayed at Hotel Dali for 5 nights in July 2008 and because I loved it so much and the staff's friendliness and helpful qualities, I returned there again at the end of August 2008 before returning home to Australia. Whilst staying there I felt like part of the Hotel Dali staff family, they are all so welcoming and help you with everything. The location is brilliant, you can walk everywhere and it is a very safe area. All commodities are within walking distance too, such as the internet cafe with computers and telephones at a very cheap price, supermarket is just down the road and the post office is there also. Great restaurants nearby too.The hotel is very quiet too, even though it is full, you don't hear any noise. Also, this is one hotel in Italy that actually has a kettle with cups in the room to make a cup of tea. Also the rooms i stayed in had a small fridge which was very handy.Overall, staying in Hotel Dali whilst in Florence just made my trip, I loved it - keep up the wonderful ambience and rates too Marco!Marianna Cara (Australia)
Reviews.Author: dearestSydney

Reviews.Content: wonderful, everything you could want it was actually lovely. there were 4 of us and we got the biggest room they had. the beds were comfortable, the staff was really nice. if you walked out of the building and looked left, you would see the duomo. it was very clean and nice. just great. it's obviously not 5 stars because it's so inexpensive, but it's incredible value for the price. just get there before 12 midnight for check in because no one will be at the desk. also ask for an outside door key because you need one to get back into the building.
Reviews.Author: ishill

Reviews.Content: Quaint  Through the lonely planet book I emailed Marco directly. The hotel phone never worked but Marco always replied to my emails. We couldn鈥檛 get a double room with a pvt bathroom. Since we were staying only 1 night we settled for a room with shared bath. The room was v pretty. The view from the room was v quaint. Sharing a bathroom troubled me but it was just for a night. The bathrooms were clean however if one showered in the bathroom at the back, water would splash all over the bathroom. There is no real seperate shower cubicle in that bathroom even though it is a demarcated area. Also the shower curtain kept coming apart.However Marco was v sweet and v friendly. He was very accommodating. We had checked out and I needed to repack my suitcase and he gave me an area with privacy to do this in before we picked up our luggage to go. It is a v nice place to stay and I would recommend it to others. There is no breakfast in the hotel but I don鈥檛 know if other hotels in Florence provide breakfast. It was not important to us. Its v central and an excellent place to stay in. Also the hotel is v easy to find.
Reviews.Author: waifbeauty

Reviews.Content: Hotel Dali - stones throw from the Duomo       hotel dali, duomo is the background
Reviews.Author: mezzagirl

Reviews.Content: Pretty Good       typical street
Reviews.Author: caughtalitesneeze

Reviews.Content: Friendliest staff in all of Italy My husband and I visited Florence in May of 2008. We spent 3 nights at Hotel Dali. I loved this hotel! The room was a little on the small side, but very clean. The bathroom was shared but also very clean. There was also a sink in the room. Our room had a beautiful view into the court yard. We slept with the windows open and the room was very quiet. The best part of this hotel was the friendliness of the staff. Everyone was very helpful. Marco made our reservations for us to the Uffizi and the Accademia. He also helped us find a little town called Scarperia and the Florence American Cementary. The other people who worked at the hotel did not speak much English but they were so friendly and willing to help with whatever they could. I felt that I was staying at one of my friend's or families' house and not staying at a hotel.  The location of the hotel is great.... v ery close to The Duomo.  I would highly recomend this hotel to anyone. Ohh and I forgot to mention....it is a great price.
Reviews.Author: Kristin2008

Reviews.Content: Friendly Staff great location huge room Location Location Location Right behind the Duomo, walking distance to EVERYTHING.We stayed for six days in May. Marco and Samanta are DELIGHTFUL and were great about booking museum reservations and restaurants. A great coin laundry is a short walk away.HUGE room VERY CLEAN comfy bed helpful staff and VALUE pricing.This is the hands down best value in Florence--- we will return.
Reviews.Author: celticmuse

Reviews.Content: Great Location, Warm Welcome, Exceeded Expectations We spent 2 days at Hotel Dali and we're very pleased with our choice of hotels. The location is great for all sightseeing. We were 2 minutes from the Duomo, 5 minutes from the Bargello, and no more than 10 from the Uffizi. The Accademia was 10-15 minutes in the other direction. We arrived by train and walked with our small 17 inch wheeled carryon bags. Took about 15 minutes. Directions were easy to follow, and you really can't get lost since the hotel is just behind the Duomo. Our room #7 was one of the largest of the trip, overlooked a tlittle courtyard and was very quiet. The shower was huge and a nice change! Marco was so helpful in making reservations at the Accademia and Uffizi. He also suggested an amazing little cafe for breakfast where they make their pasteries fresh. Truly the best of our 3 weeks in Italy. Hotel Dali even has a small lift to help when bringing bags in. This is not a 4 star hotel, but for the price, 鈧?0 cash, it was incredible value in Florence. We will definitely stay there again and really look forward to seeing Marco again.
Reviews.Author: EastCoastTim

Reviews.Content: Friendly, Excellent Location, Superb Value for Money After we stayed with Marco and Samanta at Hotel Dali, we had to email after we got home to express our thanks.We were very comfortable and well looked after the entire time. The couple and their staff were always friendly and helpful, and we felt very welcome.Marco鈥檚 advice about changing our Travellers Cheques at a local bank rather than the Exchange Bureau certainly saved us some money and we are very grateful for that.D and I liked our room very much. We also found the location to be excellent, because it meant we could easily walk to Florence鈥檚 main places of interest.When we go back to Florence one day, we will definitely want to book with Hotel Dali again.K  D (UK)http://www.hoteldali.com/pages/contact.htm
Reviews.Author: The_Friends

Reviews.Content: Nice big rooms! Located near the Duomo - We had a very big room though we did not request for a private bathroom - It came with a sink.Very friendly owner - Marco - He gave us very useful information on where to eat and introduced different parts of Florence to visit to us. Speaks good english too.
Reviews.Author: Iwry

Reviews.Content: Excellent value and great, friendly people We stayed at hotel Dali for 2 nights in mid March. Hotel Dali is in a great location near the Duomo, and within easy walking distance of the Santa Maria Novella, and the Oltroarno. The rooms are basic, but large for the money. We had an ensuite bathroom that was in good, clean, working order. Our bathroom did not have a hairdryer, but one was provided (immediately) on request. We did not use the parking, and we visited during a time of year when we did not need to use the heat or AC. Our room was attractively appointed, with a hardwood floor, and was large and very comfortable. The hotel is upstairs from street level, but there is a working lift in the building.While the room and location for Dali are a good value themselves, the real star of this hotel is the friendly, helpful staff. Marco answered all of my emails during my shopping and booking process quickly and fully, greeted us warmly on arrival, gave us lots of good advice on enjoying Florence, and generally made us feel like valued, appreciated guests to his home, rather than just customers of his business. There were others as well, just as friendly and helpful, but Marco is the primary person we dealt with. The hotel staff efficiently handled reservations for the Uffizi and Accademia on our behalf. Marco was very flexible with storage of our luggage; since we arrived very early on our first day, and stayed in Florence until very late on the day of our departure, this was a huge benefit to our trip.To all of my fellow travelers interested in a good location, a comfortable clean room, a good bargain, and a welcoming, family-like personal experience, I recommend Hotel Dali without hesitation.
Reviews.Author: angra311

Reviews.Content: Great deal in Florence A great place to stay - a real value for our family of 6. We were able to park our rental car there [not easy to drive into the courtyard] and forget about it for 3 days. Marco the owner speaks good English and was extremely helpful and the rest of the staff is very pleasant. The location could not be beat and we had no issue with noise as we faced into the courtyard. We would definitely go back.
Reviews.Author: yelraf

Reviews.Content: Convenient Hotel This Hotel was in a great location in terms of the tourist sites. However, our room faced onto the main road and was very noisy. There was constant ambulance sirens so we think it must be very close to a Hospital.The rooms were clean and comfortable, though a little tacky. The shared bathroom was clean and bright.I'd stay there again but I'd ask for one of the rooms facing the courtyard.
Reviews.Author: DebDeb07

Reviews.Content: Excellent Value for money I stayed here over a weekend while visiting friends in Florence and really thought it delivered value for money. The hotel is basic (as you would expect at this price) but the rooms were clean and bigger than I would have expected. The location is about 2 minutes from the Duomo (although Florence is fairly compact within the city walls so nothing is that far away)What makes this hotel really stand out is the staff - super friendly and helpful and really that's what makes a stay anywhere doesn't it? If on a budget you could do a lot worse than stay here. Recommended..
Reviews.Author: Matt70380

Reviews.Content: Spacious Room, Grat Staff Our room was large, well lit, and overlooked a pub. Never found it too loud that I could not sleep. We asked for a quiet room, but were located next to the restrooms for travelers without them in their room. It was never a problem and little, little, noise. We had a great location, just perfect. Marco and his staff were just so helpful, kind, gracious people who made it a point to smile, laugh, and treat you with respect and kindness. Marco speaks perfect english, the older man at night did not, but boy did he smile, laugh, pull out his bilingual dictionary and we got along just fine. They made us feel good about our stay and our choice, we appreciated them very much. The rate was good. Only negative, the bathroom could use some paint and upgrading a bit. But we loved our stay, decent, basic, and spacious-and plenty of room to move and closet space.
Reviews.Author: LuckySouth

Reviews.Content: Hotel Dali did the job We stayed at Hotel Dali in October and had a comfortable stay. The staff were helpful in providing advice on transport connections as well as useful little touches like hairdryers. The hotel itself is small but perfectly clean and quiet, in a central location just near the historic centre. We could not have asked for more especially given the modest price for its location.
Reviews.Author: savvytravel99

Reviews.Content: Perfect spot from which to explore Florence I agree with all the other reviews on this hotel. It's in the most perfect position in Florence, just around the corner from the Duomo. You can walk to everything including the train station. Lots of character and very reasonably priced. The owner is great. He was really helpful with directions and restaurant recommendations plus handy hints such as having coffee at the bar, rather than sitting - saves cash! Would definitely stay there again. I could lean out of my window and watch all the action in the street below - all the Vespas speeding by and the Italians enjoying life.
Reviews.Author: Ciao2007

Reviews.Content: Just OK I found the Hotel Dali in Rick Steve's guidebook and after reading reviews on Trip Advisor booked a four night stay. The location is good and the owners are very kind and helpful, but it is definitely a budget hotel. Our room (specifically the bathroom) was not clean although it got better with time which I attribute to the staff rotation. Hot water ran out very quickly and you definitely need earplugs. I would be prepared for what budget entails if you choose to stay here.
Reviews.Author: cm2510

Reviews.Content: A great place with helpful owners We loved our stay at the Dali! The rooms are tastefully decorated and large. The location of this place can't be beat - you are steps away from the Duomo, on a busy street. The hotel is in a large older building and you get to step through old wooden doors into the courtyard before going up to the hotel - makes you feel like you really live in Firenze for a few days. Marco the owner is extremely helpful, speaks perfect English and will help you find anything you need. He was also great to just chat with. :) The only downside of the stay was a slight weird smell in the room, but we really didn't care. :) It was a great deal for the money, gave us an opportunity to chat with locals and feel like Florentine residents, and we would certainly stay there again.
Reviews.Author: TravellingKrolik

Reviews.Content: Shame about the air con Just leaving Florence after staying at the Hotel Dali for 3 nights. The hotel itself has an excellent location right next to the Basillica and about 15mins walk from the train station. The big problem we had was that there was no air con (this is august) and because we needed to have the window open there was ALOT of noise from outside which meant that we haven't slept well the whole time we've been here. Nonetheless the owners are incredibley friendly and helpful, the rooms basic but clean and the shared bathroom spacious and cleaned daily.
Reviews.Author: anasultana

Reviews.Content: Like home away from home Hotel Dali was very easy to find, we had no problems finding it from the train station. The location is very central and a stone's throw from the Duomo. Close to everything. Marco was very friendly. He made our museum reservations a couple months prior to when we arrived. I had a ton of questions and he was very patient and willing to answer all of them. We had the room with the private bathroom. If I were to go back I would just go for the shared bathroom. I thought the shared bathroom was much nicer than the private bathroom.
Reviews.Author: chingcm

Reviews.Content: For a cheap hotel with a great location and free parking! Found this hotel via the Euro Cheapo web site. Nothing fancy, but for the price, you cannot beat the location.The Hotel Dali is directly behind the Duomo and also offers free parking (if you were crazy enough to drive to Florence as we were).It is also walking distance to the train station.The young couple who own the place are very friendly and the husband was insrumental in getting us there (we had to call them for directions from inside of Florence as we kept driving in circles - he basically stayed on the phone with us until we got there).Very clean, basic rooms with furniture restored by the wife Samantha. Ask for a room on the side overlooking the parking area - the street side can be noisy at night if that sort of thing bothers you. Shared baths - again very clean. Never a problem with waits, etc..
Reviews.Author: brunelloafcionado

Reviews.Content: Excellent everything, especially the people, the price, the location When our other hotel where we had stayed 3 times previously for long term could not accommodate us, we took to the Internet and found this magnificent bargain rate hotel with helpful, cordial couple Marco  Samanta. It is only a few blocks farther from the center than our other hotel, but well worth the walk! You are actually in a neighborhood lived-in by Florentines away from the constant influx of tour buses  just steps away from artisan workshops, little clothing, food  housewares shops, less crowded restaurants  a very charming little piazza. For most of the time, we had a hotel view of a garden with magnolia and apricot trees. We will def. stay here on our next trip to Italy.
Reviews.Author: MBarc

Reviews.Content: Location, Location, Location! The Hotel Dali rocks! No more than a few hundred metres from the Dumo, awash with retro appeal and well priced considering parking is thrown in for free. My family of 4 really enjoyed a very spacious ensuite over looking the very pleasant court yard and the unobtrusive willingness of Marco to help where ever and whenever he could. Highly recommended. NOTE: Driving in Florence is not for the faint hearted - nor is entering the courtyard carpark of the Hotel Dali. Ask the guy in the little office by the gate to guide you unless you want to lose your mirrors! At least once you're in you can abandon the car for a few days and walk everywhere.
Reviews.Author: Snuffleuffaguss

Reviews.Content: Good...Except for the Mosquitoes This hotel was centrally located near the Duomo. The owner, Marco, was very friendly and helped out my friends and I greatly with restaurant recommendations and things to do to meet the locals of Florence. The room was large and the bathroom of good size. We went in the summer and we made the dumb mistake of leaving the windows open, we were eaten alive by mosquitoes, so just keep that in mind if you stay here. I will stay again at this hotel in a hearbeat.
Reviews.Author: Bballer21

Reviews.Content: Wonderful value, great stay! This is a fabulous hotel for people wanting a budget with high standards. We stayed in a double room with shared bath. The room was huge and had a window that overlooked a picturesque courtyard. Despite no air conditioning and it being late June, our roomed stayed very very cool. The ceiling fans help tremendously. Bring ear plugs, as the birds that nest in the tree out the window are quite loud early morning. The hotel itself is very solidly built and we could never hear other guests. We had a shared bathroom, but our room was equipped with a sink and mirror. The bathrooms are simple, but do the trick - never had to wait to shower.The staff take great pride in running this hotel and it shows in the service and the rooms. Where other discount hotels would just put a sink in the wall, Hotel Dali has taken the time to hand stencil in little leaves around the sink and mirror. Our wardrobe also had the same stenciling. Lovingly placed little details make this budget stand out from the rest. The staff also treat you as if you've paid top dollar for a room in Florence. Restaurant recommendations, booking tours, and helpful directions are a few of the things they offered us during out stay. They were wonderful.I would stay again if looking for a budget hotel, most definitely.
Reviews.Author: ukduo

Reviews.Content: Enjoyable Stay! We stayed here for 2 nights at the start of May, the room was lovely and big with a great view out to the courtyard. The location was great, only a 5 minute walk to the Duomo and its in walking distance from the other major tourist sites. The staff were really friendly, pointing out places to see that we didn't know about and just generally helpful. The only negative we would add would have to be the bathrooms, not unclean but a little outdated but if you can handle that you'll enjoy your stay here as we did.
Reviews.Author: Rainsly

Reviews.Content: Thank you Hotel Dali! Great, Great, Great, Room was so nice with tons of character and clean. Staff was so helpful. The location was great - we just loved this place!
Reviews.Author: gretman

Reviews.Content: Delightful! My companion and I stayed at Hotel Dali for seven nights at the end of April. I have stayed in many resorts and + 3 star hotels over the years; and I must say that the personal attention of the proprietor and staff of this little hotel was equal to, and often exceeded, all of them. The proprietor, Marco, was able to put these non-Italian-speaking Americans immediately at ease; he provided intimate portraits of an ancient city that we would have been lucky to receive at any hotel, much less one that was this inexpensive. We had a quiet room with a shower equipped bathroom off the courtyard -- the swallows at dusk were a lovely sight . The hotel was an American two blocks from the Duomo, with many interesting shops and cafes nearby. There is a supermarket a few blocks away with great Italian groceries -- a wonderful place to pick up picnic supplies. A note to Americans: this is not suburban America -- please keep in mind that the infrastructure of Florence is ancient and the plumbing is no different -- if you have an open mind and don't expect a Disney-world experience, you will have a fantastic time.
Reviews.Author: AshleyCharlotte

Reviews.Content: Great value for money The Hotel Dali is excellent value. The week after Easter, withFlorence full of tourists, we enjoyed a quiet, twin room with our own shower room on the 2nd floor. Just 200 yds from the Duomo - it couldn麓t have been more central and convenient. There麓s a lift to relieve tourist legs and feet but above all, the staff are helpful,smiling and very positive - and I heard Italian, English and French spoken fluently I couldn麓t fault anything and the 80 Eu price was amazing.
Reviews.Author: Dids66

Reviews.Content: Fantastic! I loved Hotel Dali!!! Do yourself a favor and stay at the Hotel Dali everytime you visit Florence!!! The location is just off the Duomo Piazza and the rooms are bright, spacious and romantic. We stayed the first two nights in a sweet room overlooking the courtyard and wonderful morning light. It was a shared bath and had a sink and mirror in the room. Sharing the two bathrooms available was never a problem (of course, we were there in Feb). The last two nights were in a room with Duomo views (windows open to the street) and a private bath. It was only about 10Euro more, but I thought the shared bathroom was fine, actually. The best part of the trip was Marco, the owner. He was so helpful and patient. He really understands the importance of making people feel comfortable. Great eye contact and sense of humor. He will always be a significant part of our stories of Florence as he made quite an impression on us.
Reviews.Author: jwnphoto

Reviews.Content: Very Good Hotel Dali is in an excellent location, less than 5 minutes to the duomo. The staff were friendly. We thought the hotel was really good value for money considering its central location. Our room was spacious and clean. We had an en-suite bathroom which was perhaps a little dated but in good working order! The train station is about 15-20 minutes walk.
Reviews.Author: KB31

Reviews.Content: Brilliant I stayed at the hotel's flat, which is a two-minute walk from the hotel, for a week in early February. It's a perfect place for a longer stay - very central (a short walk to any of the major attractions), with a very basic kitchen (just a gas hob and fridge, but comes with dishes and saucepans) so you can cook your own breakfasts and dinners when you're tired of restaurants (or to save money, since Florentine restaurants are often quite expensive) and there is a grocery store just around the corner, as well as some lovely little food shops (a dairy, bakery, greengrocers, etc.). In addition to the small kitchen, there's a lounge with sofa and a dining table, a bedroom with a very comfortable double bed, and a bathroom with shower. The flat even comes with a shelf full of English language books (some tour guides and a lot of paperback bestsellers) so you don't even need to bring your own reading matter. Windows look out over the spread of Florence (I could see the top of the Duomo rising above the rooftops, and San Mineato on the other side of the River).That flat is quiet (for Florence) and comfortable, and you can live like a local for a week. The only warnings I'd give are that the ceilings are quite low in one end of the bathroom (so watch your head) and that there's no lift, so it's not suitable for someone who has trouble climbing stairs.I was so glad I stayed there - thanks to all the tripadvisor reviewers for the steer!
Reviews.Author: A-Canadian-in-London

Reviews.Content: Small and friendly - perfect!       The lovely view from our hotel room
Reviews.Author: green-hedgehog

Reviews.Content: Now this is Italy!       View from room
Reviews.Author: komori

Reviews.Content: Adorable but basic This hotel is so perfect for those on a budget but with standards! Marco is so helpful, the place is clean and tidy, welcoming and the location is central. My family love going to Florence and always stay here. Its a safe bet!
Reviews.Author: sarah00000

Reviews.Content: The hotel that could...       Old Bedroom, Mosquito Balls in Room, tired furniture - excellent staff! Sep 2006
Reviews.Author: sixsixniine

Reviews.Content: Good Budget Hotel The hotel Dali is located very a few floors in an apartment building. The location is quiet but only a 5 min walk to the main shopping areas and attractions and about a 10 minute walk to the train station. The hotel had good clean rooms which were excellent value compared to other hotels. The room was quite comfortable (with a slightly hard bed). The shared bathroom facilities were clean and new - with a small dodgy element in that one of the showers seemed to have no way of containing water. The staff were very nice and even the ones who's English was basic took the time to happily communicate with us with sign language. I would recommend staying in this hotel.
Reviews.Author: Timbo78

Reviews.Content: Excellent Service at Hotel Dali !! Marco is an excellent host for the Hotel Dali. He gave us maps, gave us good restaurant tips and directions in Florence. The room was not extravagant, but for the price, we got exactly what we wanted, decent accomodations with great service service and supreme location !!!! We would definitely go back to Hotel Dali, the bathroom shower is kind of weird as you get the whole floor wet, but other than that, this is a 5 star hotel for the price.
Reviews.Author: GPuigbo

Reviews.Content: Super, Smashing, Great! Had a lovely time at the Hotel Dali , Florence. Fantastic location and very very friendly staff who know all the best info on places times and restaurants.It is good value for money but remember this is a one star hotel. If you go their expecting an amazing, modern, air conned, glitzy hotel you will be disappointed.It is a clean, friendly, happy hotel in a fairly quiet street in the centre of the city. We would go again and recommend it to friends and family.
Reviews.Author: Gaylord

Reviews.Content: Great deal I checked into the Hotel Dali on a Saturday and had a hard time getting in the front door. You have to push the bell on the outside which says Pension. Then you walk into an unmarked entryway. Take the stairs to your left up three flights, there you will see the hotel enterance. The woman at the desk on Saturday didn't speak any English, but she was very friendly and talked lots in Italian. I had a single room that had a large double bed and it was nice and clean. The window over the street was nice and made the room very bright. There was a sink in the room with 2 shared shower/toiletts at the end of the hall. The staff that arrived during the weekdays spoke English and everyone there was very friendly with advise on restaurants and sights. You could purchase water and coffee for a minimal cost. There were cafes and restaurants nearby and an internet cafe almost right across the street. I had a very pleasant stay there. The only problem for me was that the shade on the window was lace and did not keep much of the light out in the morning. As always, I recommend ear plugs.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Good budget option My husband and I stayed at Hotel Dali for 3 nights in mid-May. It's just a (long) block from the Duomo. We had a nice view of it if we hung out our window. We were in room #12 just off the lobby with a private bath. The room was clean and quiet, but a little run down. The electric toilet in the bathroom had a slight bad smell, but nothing too bad. Marco was extremely helpful and arranged reservations for us at the museums in advance. If you're looking for something really nice, I might go somewhere else, but it was fine for the price (80 euros/night), especially considering the location. We didn't here much noise from the street.
Reviews.Author: cmchaley

Reviews.Content: Went to Florence to get married... Marco and Samanta at the hotel are so nice, caring and accomodating. We stayed in an apartment separate from the hotel, as we were there for two weeks..... Excellent accomodation, about 10 mins walk from central Florence. Quiet, secluded and lovely views from all windows. We will certainly be going back.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Budget Option My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Dali in September 2005 for 2 nights. We had a double, ensuite room. The room was ok. Old bedspreads. The bathroom is fine but there was a bad sewer gas smell coming from it for our whole stay. It was okay if you closed the bathroom door and had the fan on in the room. But it was not a pleasant smell. There is no A/C but if you can leave the window open and fan on, the room is fine. Our room faced the street and there was a bar right outside which was a little noisy at night.The location and price cannot be beat. It is right by the Duomo and everything is easily walked to. There is free parking but make sure you have a compact car. We had a Passat Sedan and it was a very tight squeeze.There is no breakfast but you can buy water, beer, and softdrinks for a good price. Also, no internet service.The staff is helpful but not all speak English.This is a decent budget traveler option.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Clean, friendly, responsive Hotel Dali I travelled to Tuscany and Umbria in November and stayed at the Hotel Dali in downtown Florence. It was my first visit to Italy and I was a bit hesitant about travelling on my own but the hotel owner Marco was helpful in providing whatever information I needed. When booking the reservation he was very responsive and kind. The rooms were immaculate and charming. Good price, excellent location near Il Duomo, with friendly and knowledgeable staff.My room overlooked a small courtyard, was quiet even though it was located on a busy street.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great hospitality        View of the Duomo from Dali room
Reviews.Author: Miramichier_DAC

Reviews.Content: Charming Hotel -- Great Location       Great Location
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Loved the Hotel Dali!       Great Location
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in great location       view from our room
Reviews.Author: Terence_Hill

Reviews.Content: The best place to stay in Florence If you are going to Florence their just one place to stay: Hotel Dali! It鈥檚 on the heart of the city 鈥?Duomo 鈥?and as the friendliest, the kindliest and niceness staff I鈥檝e every encountered. They reserved my tickets to the Uffizi and L鈥橝ccademia, and they have all this little thinks that make you feel at home. And the room, basic, had character and make us feel real good after a day of exploring Florence.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: The most comfortable and convenient hotel in Italy - without doubt The Hotel Dali is 300 steps from the Duomo so you can see you are right in the middle of the city. It used to be a palace, but it isn't ornate and grand - just very comfortable, clean but not sterile, convenient and warm hearted. The owners Marco and Samantha are very helpful - as is their staff. No stuffiness, simple courtesy and thoughtfulness. The rooms are delightful - the pictures on the i'net are real - we actually stayed in the room featured. The hotel is clean and well run - even the other visitors fit into the kind and pleasing atmosphere.Absolutely recommend Dali for anyone who wants a very fair price for very convenient and very pleasant (not over the top) accommodation. It was the one place I remember very clearly out of two months travelling in Italy. Loved it, loved Marco and Samantha and loved their travel and living advice for Florence. We extended our stay three times. And of course loved Florence which was at our fingertips.
Reviews.Author: Gailmarie

Reviews.Content: Excellent personal service at Hotel Dali We have been a whole week in September at this hotel located only a few minutes walk away from the famous Cathedral (Duomo). It is straight, clean and comfortable, with little luxury, not even breakfast in the morning, except that it provides free parking with surveillance right in the old center of Florence. But above its reasonnable prices, it has something much better to offer : Marco, its young manager, operator and receptionist, always at the desk to serve you, helping to make the best of your short or long stay in his beloved city, to find the right bus line, the best restaurant for your pocket and the best places around the hotel to have breakfast or lunch so you can eat the same cuisine Florentines do. He can also open up your mind to the Italian and Florentine cultures, and much more. He even found us a room in another hotel when we arrived in Florence one day earlier than our reservation date, and he choose a nearby hotel we could walk to so we could already put our car in his parking and avoid driving in the old center of the city. In other words, Marco offers the same high level personal service and personal relation you can get from time to time in some very good bed and breakfast. For my wife and for me, it was worth gold and made our week in Florence so much more pleasant.Michel and Francine, Qu茅bec, Canada
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Best Deal in Firenze This is a nice, safe, clean and friendly hotel with perfect location. Simply the best choice in Florence.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Service with a smile We have just returned from a delightful week's break in Florence, which was a beautiful city with many wonderful sights. Before travelling I didn't know where to stay and I used the Rough Guide to look for reasonable accommodation. I found Marco at the Hotel Dali and sent him an email to enquire about availability at the required times. He was so helpful and sorted out accommodation to suit our needs. We exchanged a couple of emails before our arrival and I knew before we got there that everything would be perfect and it was. We arrived at the hotel and Marco was waiting to greet us, he has such a perfect command of English and a great sense of humour which really helps to make you feel at home. he helped us with restaurants and was better than the tourist information centre for all the trips and concerts that we wanted to do. This hotel and Marco really are the essence of small and friendly and we had a wonderful time. I cannot wait to return to this wonderful city and we will be booking in with Marco and the Hotel Dali very soon.Gloria Allerton-Simmons, Liverpool, England.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: I Love This Place!!!
Reviews.Author: meggiesue414

Reviews.Content: great value  Marco the owner of the hotel is wonderful and very helpful. Whatever you need to know he will go out of his way to assist and he speaks very good english. The hotel is less then 30 metres from the main attractions eg. Duomo and walking from one end of the city to the other takes only 30 minutes. The hotel is very clean and fits well with the local culture. we took a room with a shared bathroom and this was never a problem as the hotel has only 12 rooms and one of the two bathrooms was always available. We have an 18 month old baby and while they have no port-a-cots or cribs the bed was big enough for the three of us. The hotel has a lift which made access from our stroller easy. The only problem was the english pub directly across the road which was very loud and doesn't close until 3am. try and ask for a room on the opposite side to avoid a restless night
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great location, great price! This hotel was recommended to us by a friend and provided everything that we needed. Room was basic but clean and light; we were sharing a bathroom, but never had to queue for it, and there was a sink in the room. What made this hotel special were the owners - they were friendly, spoke excellent English and were happy to book tickets for us to the Uffizi Gallery (which we would strongly recommend, to avoid the mile-long queue!)The location can't be faulted; we were within short walking distance of all the major sites, and the Duomo was practically at the end of the street! Would definitely stay here again, and would advise anyone travelling to Florence on a budget to do the same.
Reviews.Author: Holly_H

Reviews.Content: Nice stay in Firenze We booked over Internet and found a nice small hotel with a friendly atmosphere right in the centre of the old town, almost neighbour of the Dome. Quiet, comfortable, personally furnished rooms, some overlooking a garden with big trees - where you can also park your car.Personal, friendly management, giving good advice as to restaurants, sights and how to find them etc.Fluent English, (French and maybe more languages)We highly recommend this nice little hotel and would definitely chose it again if we return to Firenze.Kerstin and Frank Thomsen, Stockholm, Sweden
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Hotel service for apartment cost       The tree in the courtyard
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Such a friendly hotel We stayed at the Hotel Dali in March 2005 after reading about it in the Lonely Planet book. I have only just now read the reviews here and so many of them echo how we felt about the hotel - the people that work there just made the visit so special. The room was spacious and comfortable and we didn't need air conditioning because it was winter - and the room was lovely and warm. We had a courtyard room which was nice and quiet. We only stayed in the main hotel for one night, then had 2 nights in the apartment and that was just the perfect end to our holiday. The only downside of the apartment is the 4 flights of stairs when you have your suitcase, but once there it was our own private haven. Immaculately clean, well furnished and so comfortable we didn't want to leave. Marco was very helpful with suggestions and driving directions. I agree with the person who said it's hard to find when driving, but only because of the one-way streets - we got there eventually and then Marco would mark on a map the best way to go. Perfect location too - just the highlight of our trip.
Reviews.Author: KatherineNZ

Reviews.Content: The friendliest hotel in Florence! I first stayed at Hotel Dali five years ago and have returned there every year.The hotel is in a prime, central location, but is also quiet and you feel wonderfully relaxed as soon as you walk through the door. The rooms are all beautifully cared for and there are a number with views over an Italian courtyard. From every single room you wake up to hear the Florentine church bells ringing over the city rooftops.For the quality of accomodation and central location, I am always surprised at the great value when staying at Hotel Dali...it is a very good price and you are always left with a few more Euro to spend on shoes!!Although the hotel is lovely and clean, the prices are excellent value and the location is central, none of these are the best feature of Hotel Dali. The very best thing about staying are the people who work there. Often when you are travelling to a foreign city, you look for 'a base' from where you can see the sites but the owners of Hotel Dali ensure that you get much more than that. Their friendliness and hospitality are second to none and you leave Florence touched with something very unique and special. You feel as if you are a friend of Hotel Dali rather than a guest and that is true if you stay just one night or for two weeks! Everyone who works at the hotel are keen to make sure you are as comfortable as possible and will help with any information you need.I would recommend Hotel Dali as a fantastic place to stay in Florence for a touch of warmth, a ray of sunshine and a gift of something truly Italian.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Hotel Dali Apartment Highly Recommended I travelled to Florence last January, and stayed in the Hotel Dali apartment for one week. It is a wonderful, centrally located one bedroom apartment, at a very good price. Just a few blocks from the main rooms of the hotel, near the Duomo, on a top floor looking out on views of the red tiled roofs of the city, decorated in Tuscan farmhouse style, this apartment makes a comfortable, surprisingly quiet, home away from home. Perfect for couples, families or solitary travellers who enjoy living more like natives than tourists while visiting Firenza. One caution: it is a walkup, with no elevator, so guests must be able to navigate several flights of narrow stairs. I would also like to note that Marco, the owner of Hotel Dali, is a very warm and gracious person.
Reviews.Author: aelita208

Reviews.Content: Super affordable when you have a car   showReview(2866941, 'full');
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: very basic, but OK for the money   showReview(2700441, 'full');
